column5: Does that apply to dry dog food made without meat products?? Thank You
Does that apply to dry dog food made without meat products?? Thank You

CecilB...if you come through dryden on the 502...there is a walmart and an IGA but that depends on what time u come through...dont know if they carry science diet though...the vets is on the right hand side of street as u are leaving dryden just pass the graveyard...hope this helps

TJ...not sure about rainy ...but there is nothing open 24 hrs in dryden to shop....where r u headed to if u coming up to ear falls area the grocery store opens at 8 am maybe some of gas stations might have them...sorry not to much help...good luck

I copied the following from http://www.inspection.gc.ca/english/...estricte.shtml Examples of exempted commodities commercially prepared pet food that does not contain ingredients derived from Bovinae; commercially prepared pet food that contains ingredients derived from Bovinae from which specified risk material has been removed or that originates from Argentina, Australia, Brazil, Canada, Chile, New Zealand or Uruguay* You can telephone toll free for more information at: Eastern Import Service Centre (877) 493-0468 Central Import Service Centre (800) 835-4486 Western Import Service Centre (888) 732-6222

Every country has some rather hard to understand rules in these areas but it in no way reflects on the great people of your great land. Looking forward to crossing the boarder and enjoying that great land this coming weekend. Paul
When they say no potatoes does theat include french fries ect??
[font color=green size=3][b]Processed potatoes are Ok, you can take whole potatoes as long as you boil them before you cross the border,LOL.
Where is the Wal-Mart in Dryden? Coming up on 502 for the 1st time in many years so I need help gtting thru Dryden. I assume 502 is in ggod repair no washouts??????

[font color=green size=3][b]Hwy 502 has one rough section about 20k long. After the stop sign on 502 turn right, or east to Dryden. When you get to the hwy 17 junction, Walmart is East or right about 3 blks. on Hwy 17. :)

Last fall there was a restriction on bringing potatoes into Ontario, is that or any other food importation restriction still on? Any information would be appreciated, could not find anything useful on the govt web sites. Paul
The potato restriction is still on in addition to an onion restriction and a limit of 11 pounds of beef/person.
Hi Paul: Don't know if you have seen this site: http://www.cbsa-asfc.gc.ca/E/pub/cp/.../rc4161-e.html
Thanks guys, going shopping for the trip this weekend so will purchase the onions and Potatoes in Ontario. I would buy more if it up there but hate to waste good fishing time shopping. Paul
The owner of the camp I go to said he wasn't allowed to bring dog food into Canada. He had to dump 160# of dog food before he entered. F.Y.I.

unfortunatly it is all true ...no potatoes,onions or dog food into our country....such a shame that the restrictions r getting worse....WHAT WILL OUR GOVERNMENT THINK OF NEXT.....sure hope that this does not spoil your attitude toward our wonderful fishing opportunities...love meeting new n friendly people every year.:-)
Suggestions are welcomed on where to buy dog food (science diet) north of the border. Thanks
Suggestions are welcomed on where to buy dog food (science diet) north of the border. Thanks

After crossing the border at Int. Falls, is there a Wal-Mart or other store to buy potatoes and onions ? We usually cross about midnight so hopefully it would be open 24 hrs. If not in Rainy, is there a 24 hr. place in Dryden ? Thanks
